text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

Today, I got so many requests to do something
Call of Duty, in honor of

the new Black Ops 2 coming out, eeee! So,
I’m gonna make something really

special, they use the color orange a lot so
I thought, I’m gonna make a combo
pumpkin bar, yellow cake mix.

The things that you will need today will be:
big mixing bowl, 1 cup of water,

1 egg, 1 stick of butter, I like to use Tillamook.
1/2 a pack of pumpkin bar

mix, 1 box of yellow cake mix, a cake poker,
Pam baking spray, and

a round 8 inch pan. And don’t forget your
bullets!

So you just add all this in here, and then,
remember, I already 1/2 emptied this
but just use 1/2 of this recipe.
Mmmmm! Smells like pumpkin!

Once you’ve mixed all your batter, it should
look like that, it’s kind of

orange, it smells delicious, like pumpkin
and gingerbread.

You’re gonna take Pam baking spray, spray
the pan,
and then pour all this batter in.
Just dump, dump it in there.

Because it’s so thick, what you’re gonna
want to do is set your oven to

325, not 350, and you’re gonna bake it for
twice as long, for about
50 minutes, almost an hour.

You can use a spatula to get the batter out
of the bowl… Like so!

While our cake is baking, we are actually
going to decorate our cake tray.

So, what we’re gonna do is take orange frosting
and we’re actually gonna

frost the entire thing, so unscrew and just
berooooooooooooooooo!

Looks funny, but it will, it will look good
at the end.

Then take a spatula and spread it out. The
cake’s gonna sit in the middle

so if it looks a little bare in the middle,
that’s fine, you just want to make
sure to get the edges.

Once you finish frosting your tray, I’m
just gonna stick it on top of this so

it catches all of the sugar, this is just
orange sugar, you can order it online,

I found it at a nearby cake store, and we’re
gonna open it up and sprinkle
it around!
If I can open it I will do that.

I make it rain! I make it rain! I make it
rain!

I make it rain! I make it rain! I make it
rain!
Perfect!

And then you can just dump the excess sugar
in there.
No mess!

Because the cake is still in the oven, it’s
gonna take awhile to bake,

I thought we could make all the decorative
pieces that we would need out of

fondant. I got the idea for this cake from
a picture that iJustine had
tweeted awhile ago, da-da! There it is!

She was like, I like this cake, it’s so
cool!

And I was like, I think that cake is cool
too! I would like to make that!

But I’m gonna put my own spin on it. I thought
it needed a little bit more color

and it definitely needs some guns. But thank
you iJustine for the idea!
YouTube love!

So I’m gonna start with the bullets, I have
this brown fondant.

So you’re rolling it out, making 1 side
a little bit pointy, for the tip of the

bullet. Then you’re gonna take this little
tool, put 2 lines to look like the

difference between the shell. This is gold
edible spray paint. That’s right!

I didn’t even know they made this, but they
do a lot of, like, cake airbrushing
with this, with the fancy cakes!

I’m gonna cover the tip of it, and just
spray…. This part of the bullet.

Once your little bullet has dried, the gold
paint has dried, you are gonna

take ivory food coloring, and a little paint
brush, and you’re just gonna

dip it in, and paint the tip of the bullet
ivory.

I did buy the color copper, and it just came
out way too orange looking.

So you’re gonna want to use ivory, for some
reason that
looks like the copper you want.

Ta-da! Here’s a bunch of the little bullets
that I’ve been making, for our
bullet belt! Mmmm!

Now, to make the little gun that I want on
the top of my cake, I ordered this

from, I think, Think Geek, I’ll put a link
below so you can go check it out.

So I’m taking black fondant, and what you’re
gonna do is just push ‘em into

the mold, and they bend a lot, and that’s
OK. If you don’t have black fondant

you can use black chocolate melts, or grey
chocolate, whatever you want to do.

And then you’re going to peel it out and
cut off the excess fondant.
Ready, set, roop!
Boom! Look at that!
Pew-pew! Pew-pew, pew-pew-pew-pew! Pew-pew-pew-pew!
Next, we’re gonna be making a grenade.

What I did is I took some fondant, rolled
it kind of into an egg shape,

To get this color fondant I just mixed gray
fondant and black fondant,

and it ended up looking a little bit green,
a little bit metallic.

So I got my little egg shape here, and what
I did was take a toothpick

and just press it in, get that grenade look.
And then for the rest of the

grenade, I just kind of eyeballed it, I was
looking at a picture, and,

just kind of shaping it to look like the top
of a grenade.

Alright, he’s ready to go! Look how cute
he is!

Now for the last part of decoration, I’m
going to make all of these

little letters out of gray fondant, and the
Black Ops 2 out of orange fondant.

Cakes out of the oven, make sure it’s had
plenty of time to cool before you

do this, we’re going to level the cake.
I’ve set it to be about yay high,

it was way too tall! I didn’t need it to
be this big.

So what we’re gonna do is just set the cake
down and just saw through!

Then take off the top… And then, we are
going to frost the whole cake
with cream cheese frosting!

Just plop it on the top, then take your mustache-ula
and spread it around!

It doesn’t have to be perfect because we’re
gonna put fondant on top of it,

so, just make sure that all of the sides are
covered.

We just finished frosting the cake and we’ve
rolled out all this black fondant,
just gonna pick it up… Ba-doo!

And gently place it down on the cake. And
then all you need to do is press down
on the edges, all the way around the cake.

Now you’re just gonna take a knife and cut
off the excess fondant, all the way
around the cake.
Ta-da!

We’ve got our cake covered with fondant
on top of our really cool cake tray,

and now we are just going to add all the decorative
little pieces and put this
thing together!

Ta-da! We did it! We made this awesome sauce
Black Ops 2 cake, I love it,

it’s so much more colorful and it’s even
got the gun, so thank you iJustine
for the idea.

Just remember, Nerdy Nummies comes out every
Tuesday, so don’t forget to

subscribe, and if you have any other ideas
for the next Nerdy Nummies, please

leave me a comment below, I actually read
them!
And I will do my best to make them happen.
OK, thanks so much, bye-bye!
Meep!
